lead_paragraph: RUBEN--Lawrence. Weill Cornell Medicine is deeply saddened by the death of our dear friend and benefactor Lawrence Ruben. An Overseer since 2010 and Life Overseer since 2015, Larry was an esteemed and dedicated leader, serving on the Clinical Affairs/Physician Organization and the Government Relations and Community Affairs committees. Larry championed cancer research and was devoted to advancing science and medicine. In memory of his late wife Selma, Larry, along with his children Richard Ruben, Lenore Ruben and Rochelle "Shelly" Kivell generously established the Selma Ruben Conference Center at the Weill Greenberg Center. The family also left an indelible mark on Weill Cornell Medicine with the creation of the Ruben Family Conference Center at the Belfer Research Building. Along with his family and the Belfer and Saltz families, Larry also helped to establish the R. A. Rees Pritchett Professorship of Microbiology, the Rochelle Belfer Professorship in Medicine, the Arthur B. Belfer Professorship in Genetic Medicine, the Belfer Gene Therapy Core Facility, and the Arthur and Rochelle Belfer Institute of Hematology and Medical Oncology, all at Weill Cornell Medicine. Larry was the endearing patriarch of a strong and close-knit family. Our heartfelt condolences to his wife, Jan, his children, family and friends. Dr. Augustine M.K. Choi, Interim Dean Jessica M. Bibliowicz, Chairman, Board of Overseers Weill Cornell Medicine 1/3
